## Freedom of movement of goods, services and financial resources in the Russian Federation is a fundamental principle of economic policy that allows citizens to purchase, sell, exchange and transport goods, services and money within the country without needing special permits or licenses. However, federal laws can impose temporary restrictions on this freedom for the protection of state security, defense, public health, environmental protection and other important social interests. These restrictions must comply with international law and not infringe upon human rights to fair treatment of their property. The example of such restrictions includes the imposition of customs duties, quotas on certain types of goods, export bans on specific products, capital control measures, etc.
